column4: I have a few questions about software for ubuntu, can i ask in this chan?
ok, i have never used anything but windows, and am sort of limping along...im looking for a secure ftp server, and a good antivirus
is the hdd vtfs?
* i meand NTFS
i dont know vtfs?
oh...lol
yes ntfs
ntfs lol
support for write access is a bit shaky
i wouldnt try to risk your win data
instead, why dont you try to partition your drives and make a fat32 part so you can exchange files between the two?
that would be fine...imless concerned about the anti virus, and more concerned about finding a ftp program
or, you can use vmware, virtually boot into your windows partition from linux, and you can use that to download files to your hdd
hoodman you could also set up a "virtual network" using vmware
that gets rid of any file system conflicts
and as for secure ftp, use SSH lol
well, here is what its for....im running a computer that runs my ftp, and to use a program called emule
emule has a linux port
what is ssh?
ssh is secure shell
apt-cache search ssh
i used to be like you.  i was a bit scared of a win32-linux migration, but now i havent turned back
is that a peice of software, or something internally in ubuntu?
well i put it on my laptop that i use for websurfing, and it runs so much better
